intro: Ebenus laguroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cariophyllaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, sandy or gravelly soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with narrow, linear leaves arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are small, pink to purple, and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. Ebenus laguroides is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
